page.title: 11ECOLOGY WILD FLOWERS
page.content: AROUND OUR AREA THERE ARE MANY WEEDS. JUST OUTSIDE OUR CLASSROOM DOOR WE FOUND A MAYWEED,GROUNDSEL AND A DOCK. THE MAYWEED LOOKS LIKE A DAISY BUT HAS FUNNY SHAPED LEAVES.IT IS SMALLER THAN THE DAISY AND HAS A YELLOW MIDDLE AND WHITE PETALS. THE GROUNDSEL IS LONG AND THIN IT HAS LITTLE GREEN BUDS COMING OUT OF THE SIDE WITH YELLOW TIPS. THE DOCK IS A STALK WITH LOTS OF LITTLE SEEDS STICKING OUT OF THE SIDE. THE LEAF OF THE DOCK IS VERY GOOD FOR NETTLE STINGS.IT IS VERY SOFT AND FURRY. ANOTHER TYPE OF LEAF IS A CLOVER AND THERE IS A SAYING THAT SAYS IF YOU FIND A FOUR LEAF CLOVER YOU CAN HAVE A WISH THAT WILL COME TRUE. ANOTHER WEED IS A BUTTERCUP WHICH HAS A THIN STEM AND YELLOW PETALS.
